questions.question: The main principle used in Interference is ____?

explanations.b: Superposition principle is the basic principle used in the interference of light. When the incoming light waves superimpose constructively, the intensity increases while when they add destructively, it decreases.

questions.question: When Two waves of same amplitude add constructively, the intensity becomes ____?

explanations.c: As we know, I ∝ A2. Thus, as the two waves add constructively, their amplitude becomes twice and hence the intensity becomes four times.

questions.question: How does changing the distance between the single slit and the screen affect the diffraction pattern?

answers.a: It alters the intensity of the fringes
answers.b: It changes the color of the fringes
answers.c: It affects the width of the fringes

explanations.c: It affects the width of the fringes. Changing the distance between the single slit and the screen alters the angular spread of the diffraction pattern, which in turn affects the width of the interference fringes observed on the screen.

questions.question: Which parameter primarily determines the width of the central maximum in the diffraction pattern obtained from a single slit?

answers.c: The wavelength of the laser light

explanations.b: The width of the slit - The width of the central maximum in the diffraction pattern is primarily determined by the width of the slit. A narrower slit produces a wider central maximum, while a wider slit produces a narrower central maximum.

questions.question: What is the primary cause of the diffraction pattern observed in a single-slit experiment with a He-Ne laser?

answers.a: The interference of light waves from different sources
answers.b: The bending of light waves around the edges of the slit
answers.c: The reflection of light waves from the edges of the slit
answers.d: The absorption of light waves by the slit material

explanations.b: The diffraction pattern is caused by the bending and spreading of light waves as they pass through the narrow slit and encounter the edges.
